comment: Dr. Judd is a great professor. One of the best Ive had in all of my college career. She explains topics in a way that relates to things we experience in everyday life. She sets aside plenty of office hours for extra help. Easy A if you study for it
Tests are taken from the PowerPoint lectures. She exempted the final for students that had an A average, which was nice and unexpected
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Tests start off easier, and get harder as you go. If you do bad on the first couple of tests there is no point studying, because the third and fourth tests are next to impossible. These are some of the hardest tests I have ever taken. She prides herself on her difficulty. She is not well equipped to handle online classes.

Exams are tough, but it's clear on what you should expect on her exams. Funny, professional, and laid back personality. Just read the powerpoints and memorize them and you will manage a B or higher. However, I took her for a 4000 level class, so take this with a grain of salt.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: She is a very straight forward professor. Funny at times. Explains labs but grades the lab reports way too harshly. There are other professors who care more about you and your grade than she will. Very strict to sticking to her syllabus and docking points if late.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She honestly was awful. For one, she generated her tests online so they had nothing to do with the class' contents. She was very rude and unhelpful and read her powerpoints verbatim. People who are straight A students failed her tests, including myself, and we all studied. Also make sure you do the homeworks on whatever website they're on, I forget
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I had her for 1101 for the Fall semester and she's not as bad as people are saying. She does read directly from the ppt but sometimes ppl ask good questions in class which prompts her to explain things. I didn't actually do the labs but it's helpful if you skim through them. There were several in-class bonuses as well. Overall not a bad prof

Everyone in these reviews gives Professor Judd a bad rap. It was an entire class of whiny freshman that couldn't fathom a teacher not handing them an A when they complained to their parents. Go to review sessions, tons of bonus points, the lab quizzes can be tricky so know the material, and just read the book. I got an A with not a ton of effort.

This class is actually easy. I did not realize that until the end of the semester. I could have gotten an A if I wasn't lazy. Literally all you have to do is study the powerpoints to pass the exams. There are 4 homework assignments. Really easy. Use the resources on Pearson, it's extremely helpful. If you have an A by final exams, she'll exempt you
Reads directly from PowerPoint for almost every lecture. Test & Lab Quizzes are relatively hard considering the material isnt difficult. Made the class more difficult than what it actually is.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I went to all of her classes, met with her during her office hours, and did all of her extra credit. Before the final exam she told me I had an 80 in the class and then I made a 90 on the final and it brought my grade down to a C (70.3) and she wouldn't bump me. No matter how hard I tried in her class what she taught did not match up to her tests.

She is one of my least favorite teachers I have ever had. All she does is read directly from the powerpoint with little to no explanation. Her lab quizzes are a joke because she expects you to remember very stupid stuff like (question from a quiz) "from what city was the home water calculator we used online". What does that have to do with anything
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Judd's classes were always over power points she had made, yet the test information did not reflect her power points or study guides. Really suffered by enrolling in her course, i would recommend any other science teacher over Dr. Judd

She wasnt the original prof we were supposed to have and my class suffered for that. She doesnt care about the course material at all and often times she didnt know how to answer student questions. She taught us power points she made and then tested us over things she found online. She was snarky and didn't care about our low grades at all.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Very nice person. She was young and relatable. Difficult class and she makes you work for it. I went to her office hours a lot and she helped me out! I suggest that you go to all the classes and speak with her out of class! 3 test, 3 lab quizzes and a final. Also, have online homework. DO HER EXTRA CREDIT!!!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Judd is a nice lady. Very young which makes her relatable to the students. Test are not bad, but the lab quizzes are pretty difficult. She will help you if you show up to class and meet with her during office hours. If you show up to class, do your work, and put in some effort to study for test and lab quizzes you will pass the class.

I went to every class except for one even though its not mandatory. I still failed almost everything I took in this class. She realized at the end of the semester we were all failing and added over 10 points to grades. Theres 10 As in a 150 person class if that says anything. Make sure u do labs and study on u own or u will not pass. Good luck.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Likes to catch an attitude with her students when asking questions. She doesn't really know much on what she's talking about. Sci 1101 should not have been as hard as she made it. Absolutley would NEVER take her again. DO NOT TAKE

I dont have much to say except that Mrs Judd is not interested at all in teaching. She reads monotonously from the PowerPoint and adds nothing so you may as well skip class and read them yourself. Either way, you wont get above an 85 on the tests because theres always material that wasnt taught on it. Shes nice enough, just not a great teacher.

This was her first time teaching this class and it showed. The only way we received the material was through lectures. She does provide extra credit that involves doing group work in class. Essentially the only reason to go to class is for the extra credit. The tests included any material that are apart of the chapter. The lab quizzes are detailed.

Dr. Judd is hilarious, she's very real and cares for her students. Her tests are very difficult, multiple choice T/F and free response, but she gives lots of extra points and curves and gives bonus quizzes. Easy homework. Our last test she curved by 15 points. Final is cumulative, not sure how that will be but right now I have a low B.
Dr. Judd has great reviews for her biology class. DO NOT TAKE HER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE. Her tests are crazy hard, and she does not understand that we are not on her level.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She reads right off the powerpoint but they are online so you really don't need to go to class. Lab quizzes suck and tests are pretty tough but she is a cool teacher. I'm probably failing but she works with me so it's pretty nice.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE. 4 tests and 3 lab quizzes, each feel impossible. my class averages for tests were below failing. she reads off ppts the whole class & posts them on D2L so pointless to go to class. quizzes are super hard, make sure you memorize the whole lab to pass. tests are whack and don't recommend. each test is on 3 chps, most profs are on 1 chp

She's not a bad person, she was always good at getting back to my emails, but she literally does not have a clue about this subject or how to teach it. Labs quizzes do not reflect the labs and tests are challenging. Little homework. If you solely rely on the textbook and disregard her lectures, you may make it out okay. Probably best to avoid her.

absolutely horrible. reads off of the pots and doesnt really care about the students. once said i dont care how yall do i still get paid either way. the lab portion is just four quizzes over 3 lengthy labs that she gives no context about. we had to basically beg her for extra credit, one of which she may not put in. would give -5 if possible!!

Her class has a learning curve, its important to use every resource possible for her class because she expects you to remember specific details to each term/chapter, if you intend on skating by in her class you wont do well
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: She's fine. She lectures straight off the screen, but if you're willing to talk to her she's willing to help you. The labs make zero sense, and the exams seem easy but every time I get a C no matter how much I study, but if she knows you're putting in effort she won't let you fail, you just probably won't get an A.

She is cool . as a person but reads straight off the powerpoints she creates. No . point in going to . class because she posts the powerpoints. Also before each test she creates an exam review which is NOTHING like the test. I am a straight A . student and have a C in her class right now.

theres absolutely no point in coming to class. she reads the powerpoints verbatim with no enthusiasm whatsoever. she teachers the class like she hates the material shes teaching. the labs quizes look nothing like the labs which you dont even go over in class so u dont know if youre doing it right. the powerpoints dont help u on the test. drop her

She isn't the best professor. She reads straight off of the screen in the class and posts the lectures online so there is no point in showing up. No matter how much you study you can still fail because the tests are nothing like what she teaches us. You go into every test and quiz blind basically. She makes the material harder than it needs to be.

I've seen some bad comments about her but most of those are people who either didn't show up to class and their grade reflected it, or they were disruptive. She's a fine professor. She lectures power points, answers questions, and doesn't like being talked over. I didn't need the textbook because her powerpoints ARE the textbook. Barley any hw.

You can study for days, feel confident that you know the content, but still fail. Labs are confusing and dont prepare you for the quizzes AT ALL. Personally, I spent hours studying and still failed tests and quizzes frequently and Im a student with an A and B average in my other classes.

She's unprofessional and usually catches an attitude during lectures. Told the class she'd 'cuss us out'. Lectures & reviews barely reflect the exams because she doesn't make the exams. You can study regularly and still fail the exams. She actually said that 'it doesn't matter what y'all make on the exams, she still gets paid'. Would rate zero.
If you have her for Bio-shes great. If you have her for science-drop it while you can. Shes not even totally sure what to teach and it manifests into confusing criteria on the tests. Good luck
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Took her in the summer. She is very clear of what material that's going to be on the test, you just have to study and know everything on the ppts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took her in the spring. Homework is a big chunk of your grade. Basically you can't fail unless you literally do nothing. Really know everything on the ppts and you won't fail the tests. She's a very fair professor.

Homework online mastering bio is 50% of your grade, there is no late credit so DO YOUR HW. I missed a few weeks and it killed my grade. She does not allow make ups! Pop quizzes which are easy if you pay attention, tests are easy and not too in depth. If you do the homework and do decent on the tests an A or B is easy
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Take her!! This is a for sure A with some effort. Grade consisted of 3 exams, mastering hw, quizzes and the final. Lowest quiz grade dropped. She provides so much extra credit that helps a lot!! She doesn't take attendance but don't skip class, she gives quizzes sometimes in the middle of lecture. HW is 50% of your grade so don't miss it!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--EXTRA CREDIT
